author: wsjcom
title: Gerrymanders Are Better Designed by Judges
text:
In your editorial “Political Judges of Gerrymanders” (March 29), you ask “why is a partisan map drawn by Democratic judges better than a partisan map drawn by GOP legislators?” In the Pennsylvania case all you have to do is compare the cartoonish map which the judges rejected with the compact and geographically rational map which the court imposed. Moreover, the new map is hardly partisan since it still tends to produce a majority of Republican districts despite the fact that the GOP is the minority party in the state.
John...
